results.title: Crime over London
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zeisler, Marcel Hellman and Criterion Ltd
results.brief_description: A British drama revolving around a store owner who shelters gangsters trying to evade the law. Cast includes Margot Grahame, Paul Cavanagh, Joseph Cawthorn, Basil Sydney and Rene Ray. Written by Norman Alexander and Harold French, based on the novel ‘House of a Thousand Windows’ by Louis De Wohl. Photographed by Victor Armenise and Claude Friese-Greene. Edited by Conrad von Molo.

results.title: Woyzeck. Heart of glass
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Walter Saxer and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: Woyzeck (1979): This film portrays the tragedy of a soldier who kills his unfaithful mistress who has had his child. He hears terrifying voices, he is victimised by his superiors and, in order to support his child, he takes part in a scientific experiment which results in his malnutrition. All or any of these factors could be the cause of his apparent madness. Cast includes: Klaus Kinski and Eva Mattes. “Heart of Glass” (1976): This visionary film with a resemblance to a folk tale is set around 1800. It begins with a prophet shepherd describing the Apocalypse. In the valley below, the foreman of a glass factory has died and with him the secret of producing an exquisite glass ruby from which the whole community lives. In his search for the formula, the factory owner is overcome with a madness that engulfs the village. Cast includes: Clemens Scheitz and Sonja Skiba. Both films in German with English subtitles.

results.title: 4 Shorts by Werner Herzog
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Walter Saxer and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: A compilation of four short documentary films by Werner Herzog, dubbed one of the most eccentric characters in New German Cinema. “How much would a woodchuck chuck”: An offbeat documentary on the annual World Championship of Livestock Auctioneers in the Amish region of Pennsylvania’s Lancaster County. “Woodchuck” includes a series of hilarious interviews showing the complex tongue-twisters, breathing exercises and secret signals used by the contestants. “La Soufriere”: A record of an ardent and unfulfilled journey to the island of Guadaloupe by the director and two cameramen, to see the eruption of volcano La Soufriere. Once there, they find the population has fled before poisonous gas emissions and tremors, save for three men who have stayed to await their impending deaths. The volcano subsides and Herzog withdraws unrequited. “The Great ecstacy of Woodcarver Steiner”: This film studies Walter Steiner, a woodcarver and one of the leading championship ski jumpers in the world. Herzog follows Steiner’s preparation for the Championships in Yugoslavia, setting up cameras on giant ramps to slow down the action by twenty times. “The Flying doctors of East Africa”: An absorbing documentary on the work of an independent group of physicians in remote areas of East Africa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Werner Herzog, Walter Saxer and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion

results.title: The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser = Jeder fur sich und Gott gegen alle
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Walter Saxer and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: Regarded as Herzog’s finest film, “The Enigma of Kasper Hauser” is based on a true story about a 19th Century genius. His origins shrouded in mystery, Kasper Hauser was found wandering the streets of Nuremberg in 1820. Without speech, nor any sign of parentage, Hauser immediately becomes the object of scrutiny from the town authorities. After learning to talk he tells of living in a cellar, displaying no signs of having had any contact with other human beings since childhood. In his attempts to adjust to adult life, he reveals a highly advanced intelligence and alternative, almost prophetic, vision. Herzog demonstrates his fascination with misfits, and as the story develops, the confrontation between innocence and corruption intensifies. Cast includes Bruno S, Walter Ladengast and Brigitte Mira. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fitzcarraldo
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Lucki Stipetic and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: An intense and enthralling portrait of an intrepid and obsessed impresario with a desire to bring both Enrico Caruso and an opera house to the deepest jungles of South America. The highlight of the story is Fitzcarraldo’s Herculean effort to haul a 300-plus ton steamboat over the mountains, for which no trickery was used in filming the gruelling sequence. Director Werner Herzog boldly embarked on the same journey, proving to be as driven and single-purposed as his protagonist, the audience’s knowledge of this adding to the excitement. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Claudia Cardinale, Jose Lewgoy, Miguel Angel Fuentes and Paul Hittscher.

results.title: Mars attacks! [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Franco and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).

results.title: The Searchers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) resolves to find his niece, abducted by Indians at the close of the Civil War. It is an odyssey which takes five years, by the end of which he plans to take revenge on the Indians for the friends and family he has lost. John Ford used sumptuous Monument Valley as a background for this his most poetic and complex western. Cast includes Vera Miles and a young Natalie Wood. Based on a novel by Alan Le May. A documentary written and directed by Nick Redman entitled, “A Turning of the earth: John Ford, John Wayne and ‘The Searchers’”, featuring outtakes, home movies and the original theatrical trailer precedes the film. Introduced by Patrick Wayne.

results.title: The Wild bunch [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Phil Feldman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1913, a gang known as “The Wild Bunch”, rode into a Texas border town disguised as U.S. soldiers. Silently they entered the railroad office and robbed it. Perched on the rooftops above was a ring of hired gunmen waiting for their prey. When the gang emerged they opened fire. An exciting, provocative and influential film that breathed new life into Westerns, it brings together an all-star cast of fine actors at the peak of their talents to play the band of magnificent losers in a dying, lawless West. A documentary, “The Wild Bunch: an album in montage”, as well as a new introduction by Ernest Borgnine precedes the movie.

results.title: Unforgiven [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Malpaso Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood’s film is an exciting modern classic that rode off with four 1992 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Director. Eastwood and Morgan Freeman play retired down-on-their-luck outlaws who pick up their guns one last time to collect a bounty offered by the vengeful prostitutes of the remote Wyoming town of Big Whiskey. Richard Harris is an ill-fated interloper, a colourful killer for hire called English Bob. Gene Hackman is the sly and brutal local sheriff whose brand of law enforcement ranges from unconventional to ruthless. Big trouble is coming to Big Whiskey.

results.title: Enter the dragon [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Fred Weintraub, Paul Heller, Concorde Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the biggest martial arts epics ever filmed. Bruce Lee, determined to avenge the murder of his sister, enters the island fortress of crime warlord Han. Lee staged his own fighting sequences in the movie and the sequences are thrilling in their timing and execution. ‘Enter the dragon’ was Lee’s last film and his untimely death at a young age, a few weeks after the film’s completion had made this a landmark film of its genre.
